oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn. Mrs. Horace Brock telegram against ratification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mrs. Horace Brock, Chairman Republican Section National AntiSuffrage Assn., Gloucester, Mass., telegram to Harry Burns (sic.) against ratification. #437. August 19, 1920.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women's suffrage; Politics & government; Telegrams;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Majority of women are antisuffragists and will not forget you you (sic.) have dealth (sic.) a serious blow to Republican party and killed the chance it had to win the South. Mrs. Horace Brock, Chairman Republican Section National AntiSuffrage Assn."
